intro: Xylopia phloiodora, commonly known as the African bitter almond, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or red when mature. Xylopia phloiodora is notable for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
